New Records: Sunil Chhetri became the 8th player in the world and the first Indian footballer to play 150 or more international matches.
Sunil Chhetri is the third-highest goal scorer amongst the active players.
Key Match Events: India lost to Afghanistan 2-1 in the FIFA World Cup 2026 Qualifier.
Sunil Chhetri scored the only goal for India, his 94th international goal.
Pre-Game Insights: No pre-game insights provided in the article.
Post-Match Reflections: No post-match reflections provided in the article.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India has just four points from four matches in the four-team Round 2 group.
India has two more games against Asian champions Qatar and Kuwait.
Others: Sunil Chhetri is considered one of India's best men’s football players.
Sunil Chhetri has been named AIFF Male Player of the Year seven times.
Sunil Chhetri played his first international match for India in 2005 and scored his first goal for the senior India national football team against Pakistan.

Sunil Chhetri has been part of the Indian men’s football team that has won the Nehru Cup (2007, 2009, 2012) and the South Asian Football Federation (SAFF) Championship (2011, 2015, 2021). He played a crucial role in India’s 2008 AFC Challenge Cup win, which helped them qualify for the first AFC Asian Cup (2011) in 27 years.
